title: Ping Localhost
description: Ping your localhost address (127.0.0.1) exactly 3 times.
man_page_info:
ping - send ICMP ECHO_REQUEST to network hosts.
Example: ping [OPTION]... HOST
Key options (Linux): -c (count), -i (interval). For Windows, -n (count), -w (timeout).
hints: Use the '-c' option to specify the count of pings.
The command might vary slightly based on your OS (e.g. for Windows, it is -n instead of -c). For this exercise, assume a Linux-like environment where -c is used.
